events.comment: Colocar o evento de trocar varivel, para pegar quando os monstros matam o boneco
Quando tocar na borda limitadora de baixo, morre tambm
Comportamento das bordas para definir a rea que o jogador e a cmera vo acessar
Se o jogador cair em cima da criatura
Adicionar a pontuao de matar o monstro
Pular no monstro e quicar nele
Desabilitar o comportamento do monstro e fazer esse mexer enquanto cai at sair da viso

events.name: Limpar objetos da tela conforme eventos

events.comment: Remover a Death Creature do jogo quando ultrapassar limite da tela
Redefinir a cor de todos os outros checkpoints
Customizar apenas o checkpoint que o jogador est tocando

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: EllipseMovement

events.comment: Evaluate the center of movement from the object position and properties.
Update the center when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Place the object according to the movement angle.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Update the movement angle for the next frame.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the turning direction (left or right).
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleTurningLeft

eventsFunctions.description: Change the in which side the object is turning (left or right).
eventsFunctions.name: SetTurningLeft

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is turning left.
eventsFunctions.name: IsTurningLeft

eventsFunctions.description: Return the movement angle of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MovementAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Return the loop duration (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: LoopDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ellipse radius on X axis.
eventsFunctions.name: RadiusX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ellipse radius on X axis.
eventsFunctions.name: RadiusY

eventsFunctions.description: Return the movement center position on X axis.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the movement center position on Y axis.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterY

eventsFunctions.description: Change the radius on X axis of the movement.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRadiusX
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the radius on X axis of the movement of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the radius on Y axis of the movement.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRadiusY
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the radius on Y axis of the movement of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the loop duration.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLoopDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the loop duration of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the movement angle. The object is teleported according to the angle.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMovementAngle

propertyDescriptors.label: Radius of the movement on X axis
propertyDescriptors.name: RadiusX

propertyDescriptors.label: Radius of the movement on Y axis
propertyDescriptors.name: RadiusY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the text of the button label.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label text.
eventsFunctions.name: LabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterWithPaddingY

eventsFunctions.description: Center the label according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterLabel

eventsFunctions.description: De/activate interactions with the button.
eventsFunctions.name: Activate

eventsFunctions.description: Check if interactions are activated on the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsActivated

propertyDescriptors.label: Label offset on Y axis when pressed
propertyDescriptors.name: PressedLabelOffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Elairyx, @Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkpoints
description: This extension can save checkpoints and respawn objects at the last one.
The platformer example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer)).

eventsFunctions.description: Update a checkpoint of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: SaveCheckpoint

eventsFunctions.description: Change the position of the object to the saved checkpoint.
eventsFunctions.name: LoadCheckpoint

parameters.longDescription: Loading not yet saved checkpoints will (by default) set the position to the coordinate 0;0. Select "yes" to completely ignore non-existant checkpoints. To define an alternative checkpoint for it, create a new event and use the "Checkpoint exists" condition, save the wanted checkpoint as the action.
parameters.name: SetIgnoreUndefined

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a checkpoint has a position saved / does exist.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckpointExist

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
It can be used for:
- Hit or impact
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Calculate Scale shake
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
ScaleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase scale
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ScaleDisplacement = -1 * (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables

eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangleMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on a rectangular path.
description: Move objects on a rectangular path and give a choice between easing functions (speed shapes).
It can be used for:
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
The platformer example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer)).
An example allows to check some settings ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://rectangular-movement)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RectangleMovement

events.comment: Set the initial state according to the configuration.
Update the rectangle when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Move the object on the rectangular path.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Step on the path.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the movement top bound of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the right bound of the rectangular movement.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRight
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the movement right bound of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the bottom bound of the rectangular movement.
eventsFunctions.name: SetBottom
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the movement bottom bound of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time the object takes to go through a horizontal edge (in seconds).

eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the time _PARAM0_ takes to go through a horizontal edge to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time the object takes to go through a vertical edge (in seconds).

eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the time _PARAM0_ takes to go through a vertical edge to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the direction to clockwise or counter-clockwise.

eventsFunctions.name: BottomRightDuration

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SmoothCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_camcoder_gopro_go_pro_camera.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
description: The camera follows an object according to:
- a frame rate independent catch-up speed to make the scrolling from smooth to strong
- a maximum speed to do linear following ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap)) or slow down the camera when teleporting the object
- a follow-free zone to avoid scrolling on small movements
- an offset to see further in one direction
- an extra delay and catch-up speed to give an impression of speed (useful for dash)
- position forecasting and delay to simulate a cameraman response time
A platformer dedicated behavior allows to switch of settings when the character is in air or on the floor. This can be used to stabilize the camera when jumping.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SmoothCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
Delaying and forecasting can be used at the same time.
Forecasting only use the positions that are older than the one used for delaying.
The behavior uses a position history that is split in 2 arrays:
- one for delaying the position (from TimeFromStart to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay)
- one for forecasting the position (from TimeFromStart - CamearDelay to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay - ForecastHistoryDuration

At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * speed

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * speed

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * speed^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln(speed))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

eventsFunctions.description: Update delayed position and delayed history. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateDelayedPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update delayed position and delayed history of _PARAM0_

events.comment: Add the previous position to have enough (2) positions to evaluate the extra delay for waiting mode.
Use the object center when no delay is asked.
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful for delaying and pass it to the history for forecasting.
Don't move the camera if there is not enough history.

Add the extra delay that could be needed to respect the speed limit in waiting mode.

speedRatio = min(speedMaxX / historySpeedX, speedMaxY / historySpeedY)
delay += min(0, timeDelta * (1 - speedRatio))
The time with delay is now between the first 2 indexes

eventsFunctions.description: Add a position to the history for forecasting. This is called 2 times in UpadteDelayedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: AddForecastHistoryPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Add the time:_PARAM2_ and position: _PARAM3_; _PARAM4_ to the forecast history of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful.
Keep at least 2 positions because no forecast can be done with less positions.

eventsFunctions.description: Update forecasted position. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateForecastedPosition

events.comment:
Simple linear regression
y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX

Note than we could use only one position every N positions to reduce the process time,
but if we really need efficient process JavaScript and circular queues are a must.

VarianceX = sum((X[i] - MeanX))
VarianceY = sum((Y[i] - MeanY))
Covariance = sum((X[i] - MeanX) * (Y[i] - MeanY))

y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX
Axis permutation to avoid a ratio between 2 numbers near 0.
Permute back axis

eventsFunctions.description: Project history ends position to have the vector on the line from linear regression. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ProjectHistoryEnds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Project history oldest: _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ and newest position: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Perpendicular line:
pA = -1/a; 
pB = -pA * x + y

Intersection:
/ ProjectedY = a * ProjectedX + b
\ ProjectedY = pA * ProjectedX + b

Solution that is cleaned out from indeterminism (like 0 / 0 or infinity / infinity):
ProjectedX= (x + (y - b) * a) / (a + 1)
ProjectedY = y + (x * a - y + b) / (a + 1)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ratio between forecast time and the duration of the history. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ForecastTimeRatio
